climbs.name: Tres Cojones e un Cuernito
climbs.fa: Steve McCorkel, Matt Flach and Ken Duncan

content.description: Clip bolts angling left.  Then straight up to gain the large overlap.  Use gear in the overlap and finish with 2 bolts to a bolt anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts; small gear, you may find it nice to place about 3 small nuts in the overlap.
content.location:
This route is on the small buttress above and behind Mary's Bust.  The route starts approximately in the center and low point of the face.

Hike up to Moon Light Rock and traverse north on the ledge at the top of Mary's Bust Left (see BG's bata photo: current routes on Mary's Bust, Left Buttress. He has routes 10 and 11 marked on the face).

content.description:
"Pot of Gold" climbs the center of the main wall in the Golden Hall.

Climb a thin seam past 5 bolts with a thin crux moving beyond the 5th bolt after the seam ends. Move into the arching crack system to the right where the difficulty eases for 2 more bolts. Another technical redpoint crux awaits as you climb past another 3 bolts until reaching the horizontal break (this is the crux of "

Over the Rainbow

"). Climb the left side of the upper bulge through moderate terrain past the last 2 bolts to reach the anchor out right.
content.protection:
12 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.

A stick clip is recommended for the first bolt.

content.description:
Start with the first 5 bolts of "Rain on the Mountain". Instead of moving out right onto the slab at the 5th bolt, move left, and continue up the arching crack/seam feature toward the top of the wall. Slings are recommended for the 5th and 6th bolts to reduce rope drag. Climb past 4 more bolts with increasing difficulty through the crux until you reach the horizontal break. Clip 2 more bolts through moderate terrain as you climb the left side of the upper bulge, and mantel onto the final ledge to reach the anchor out right.

This was originally established as a spicy mixed route. More bolts were later added to make it a better protected sport route.
Start on the very left side of the face, clip bolts angling right.  Then proceed straight up on the golden brown and delicious face.
content.protection: Bolts to a bolt anchor.  (We found it helpful to sling a small boulder for the belay, to better see the leader).
content.location:
This route lies on the small buttress behind and above Mary's Bust, left of the route

Tres Cojones e un Cuernito

(see that route description for approach info.)

content.description:
This is a link-up of "

3CEUC

" and "

GBD

". It climbs the hardest portions of both routes.

Start with the first 5 bolts of "

3CEUC

", then move left over moderate terrain and clip the connecting bolt on the traverse for the route "?Morning Town?". Climb up to the 5th bolt on "

GBD

," and finish with the rest of that route to reach the 2 bolt anchor at the top.

This link-up offers lots of thin technical face climbing on small holds.
